title: How can song revenue be split between contributing parties automatically? - Quora

response.answer_text: Only the royalties paid through BMI/ASCAP/SESAC can be so split fairly effortlessly.  So long as all the claimants' claims total 100% or less on the writers' side then BMI will pay out per the information supplied to them from one or more sources. Once the claims total more than 100%, nothing gets paid out until resolved or litigated. Similarly on the masters side,  SoundExchange can handle splits once informed. It will take a lot more effort to get HFA monies split. The underlying problem is that any 1 co-author who has not assigned admin. rights can collect all the money on a non exclusive license, albeit with the obligation to account to the other co-authors.

In addition to the automatic split payments the PROs and SoundExchange provide, I've only found one digital distributor Loudr that will automatically distribute royalties from sales and streams.  Other than that, unfortunately you usually need to stipulate in a contract who will administer and collect income and distribute to the other parties in a given amount of time.
